intro: Sibthorpia pichinchensis, commonly known as the Pichincha sibthorpia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, with lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
